permanent_residency.title: Fast track to Permanent Residency
permanent_residency.intro: Those who qualify for the HSFP visa are also eligible to fast-track their Permanent Residency application. You must meet one of the following conditions:
permanent_residency.condition1: Be able to prove 80+ points at the time of application and 1 year ago
permanent_residency.condition2: Be able to prove 70+ points at the time of application and 3 years ago
permanent_residency.visa_note: You don't necessarily need to be on the HSFP visa already to take advantage of this fast-track to Permanent Residency. Just being able to prove you have the points in the past and currently is enough.
permanent_residency.length_warning: However, just like any other Permanent Residency route you must already be on a valid visa with a length of stay of three years or longer.

evidence.title: Required evidence
evidence.description: When applying for this visa you need to submit evidence proving your qualifications. The documents listed below are for reference - depending on your situation, you may need all listed documents or only some. If you have significantly more than 80 points (e.g., 100+), you don't need to provide evidence for every single point category. For the most accurate guidance, consider consulting a licensed administrative scrivener (行政書士) to prepare your application.
evidence.empty: No specific evidence requirements based on your selections.

uni_ranked.title: Ranked university
uni_ranked.prompt: Did you graduate from a top 300 university?
uni_ranked.explanation:
Foreign universities need to be listed in at least two rankings, Japanese universities only need to be listed once.

  • QS World University Rankings
  • THE World University Rankings
  • Academic Ranking of World Universities
